properties.description: Multiple cases of botulism occurred in El Paso and were traced back to baked potato dip.
Several people fell ill with botulism after eating contaminated commercial cheese sauce at a restaurant.
Cases of adult botulism occurred after consumption of home-canned asparagus
Several people were hospitalized after consuming contaminated mascarpone cheese
This case of botulism was ascribed to pickled eggs.
Smoked and salted omul fish was improperly prepared and caused illness in many people in the Irkutsk Region
Muktuk (a food made of  fermented chunks of blubber, skin, and meat from a white whale was found to be contaminated with botulism
Rotten poultry and a processed meat called kashir caused an outbreak of botulism
Peyote tea that was consumed during a religious ceremony was contaminated with botulism
Consumption of Green Olives Bella di Cerignola led to hospitalization of workers and customers of an Italian restaurant
"Ribollita Toscana", or "Minestrone Di Verdure" which are vegetables packed in glass jars were found to be contaminated with botulism
Hickory Farms Beef Stick, a beef summer sausage product is thought to be contaminated with botulism toxin
Several drug addicts had to placed on ventilators after showing clinical symptoms of botulism.
A massive outbreak of botulism occurred due to consumption of badly cooked fish from Lake Baikal
A wave of deaths occurred due to contamination of botulism toxin in mortadella sausages from an unapproved factory and other food items are believed to be contaminated as well
A heroin addict became ill due to botulism poisoing after injecting contaminated substance
Contaminated fish at a wedding led to many illness and deaths due to botulism poisoning
A 1-month-old infant was admitted to a New Jersey hospital with botulism symptoms that called for ventilation for 13 days.
A 5-month-old child suffered from botulism posioning after consuming formula
A patient has been hospitalized after consuming an undisclosed food product believed to be contaminated with C. botulinum

A 10-week-old infant was admitted to the hospital after having difficuty in sucking and swallowing for 2 days. Mechanical ventilation was required due to respiratory failure. The child was discharged after remaining in the hospital for 20 days.
Sobey's Own Beef Jerky products are thought to be contaminated with C. botulinum
A male drug addict became severely ill after injecting a contaminated substance
SMA nutrition has issued a recall for 2 of its powder baby formulas
Sheriff Blaylock's brand chili caused illness in several people after being consumed during a local church meal
INDIANLife Food corporation warns customers not to consume their roti and naan bread products due to a possible contamination
Green House brand canned organic bean products may be contaminated with C. botulinum
Gefilte fish sold at a retail store is being recalled due to possible contamination
L'Abbaye St-Benoit brand Creme de Bleu/Cream, processed blue cheese is believed to be contaminated
Several  drug users fell ill after injecting contaminated substances
Gefilte fish produced by "Meytal" company is being investigated for possible contamination
Several  drug users fell ill after injecting contaminated substances
A young boy and girl were hospitalized after consuming commercially packaged pilchards (small fish) from a rusty can
Several villagers became ill after sharing a meal of whale blubber
Wylwood Select asparagus cans are being recalled due to possible contamination
Cape May Foods' LaMonica brand of chopped clams is believe to be contaminated with C. botulinum
A man became ill after consuming ready-to-eat garlic in chili oil dressing
Internationally distributed halal meat products (beef poultry sausage) were found to be contaminated with C. botulinum
A family became ill and were hospitalized after consuming tainted sausage
Several people were hospitalized after eating oerakfisk, a semi-fermented fish, that was prepared at home
Participants in a birthday celebration were hosptialized after consuming contaminated homemade canned corn
Akita Food Inc is warning customers not to consume Compliments brand Citrus Infusion Dipping Oil because it may be contaminated
Many injecting drug users were hospitalized after injecting contaminated substances
Domestic canned eggplant which was contaminated caused botulism poisoning in a group of people
Several people were hospitalized after consuming dried fish
Five illnesses and one death were due to contaminated smoked omul sold by private sellers at a train station. The remaining cases were attributed to contaminated fish from various sources.
A contaminated batch of heroin may have caused illness in several injecting drug users
Several people were hospitalized after eating dried fish they bought in a metro station.
An unapproved wrinkle treatment using botox caused illness in several patients who were then hospitalized
Several inmates are being treated after consuming a prison-made alcoholic concoction called pruno from bread crusts, fruit scraps and potato peels
Botox injections may have led to botulism poisoning
Several people came into a local hospital after injecting a dirty batch of black-tar heroin

Whole Bamboo Shoots, imported into Canada by Canda Enterprise Co Ltd, may be contaminated with Clostridium botulinum and should not be consumed. The product has been distributed in Alberta and British Columbia.
A cluster of 14 cases of wound botulism in injecting heroin users has been reported in Germany.
Many workers at an organization contracted botulism after eating dried fish prepared in a home.
A 25-year-old woman in her 6th month of pregnancy consumed preserved tomatoes and smoked sausage, from which she contracted botulism.
Several people were hospitalized after eating a home-made preserved salad.
Several people were hospitalized after consuming domestically canned vegetables. Overall, there were 21 cases of botulism reported in Kyrgyzstan in 2005.
Several people were hospitalized with botulism after consumind domestically prepared canned food.
Botulism cases connected to the use of smoked fish and home-canned food were reported in Russia.
Cases of botulism were reported after people consumed a salad prepared from home-canned food (tinned cucumbers) at a school in the Avtozavodskoy district of the city.
Many cases of botulism were reported in Rostov due to inadequate food canning.
Many people contracted botulism after eating contaminated fish. 6 of these cases were due to salt omul prepared at home.
Three family members were hospitalized with a diagnosis of botulism after consuming dried fish processed by a local business.
Four people became ill after eating fermented salmon in unnamed Interior Alaskan villages.
A family was hospitalized as a result of botulism poisoning from an unknown food source
A barbeque with a variety of homemade food items led to botulism poisoning in several guests
Consumption of frozen chick pie by a family led to severe poisoning due to contamination.
Mario Saroli Sales Inc. warns customers not to consume their Green Bella di Cerignola Olives because they may be contaminated
Severe botulism poisoning occurred as a result of the consumption of Bolthouse Farms carrot juice
Select Food Products is warning the public not to consume certained gravy and chili saucecanned products due to possible contamination
Another patient was hospitalized after consuming Bolthouse Farms carrot juice
A woman fell ill with botulism poisoning after consuming vacuum-packed smoked whitefish
A Polish national was hospitalized after eating a home-cooked meal sent by his wife
Mushroom poisoning led to several fatalities and illness due to botulism contamination
Consumption of smoked/dried fish, tinned meat, and vegetables that were prepared domestically and contaminated with Botulism led to many illnessed in the region
Homemade canned mushrooms that were prepared in 2005 caused illness in locals and their visiting relatives
Homemade canned mushrooms of several varieties caused mild to serious illness in inhabitants of several towns
Domestically canned mushrooms, stewed meat, and fish caused illeness in several towns due to improper heating and cooking
After eating salted omul fish a patient died  before arrival of an ambulance
A serious outbreak of botulism resulting from the consumption of locally produced canned bamboo shoots cause a full alert of a possible biological attack
Another outbreak occurred as a result of exposure to raw deer meat and gut
Domestically prepared fish that were improperly stored were found to be contaminated with Botulism
Several patients were admitted to the hospital with botulism after consuming dried fish
Wild mushrooms of different varieties that were improperly cooked caused illness in several towns in Ukraine
3 drug users were found dead after injecting themselves with contaminated heroin. Botulism contamination is suspected.
Contaminated black tar heroin caused botulism among drug users
Employees at a lab in the Cummings School of Veterinary Medicine at Tufts University were exposed to the Clostridium Botulinum toxin from food and water sources when a centrifuge malfunctioned

An older asian couple prepared fermented tofu (soybean curd) at home, storing it for days during and after its preparation. Clostridium botulinum spores germinated on the fermented tofu and the couple was hospitalized with botulism.
East Coast Foods Inc. is recalling cans of Kaija brand uneviscerated Herring in Special Brine due to possible contamination
Carrot juice beverage from Bolthouse Farms was confirmed to have caused several illnessed due to contamination with Botulism toxin type A
A patient was hospitalized with severe botulism poisoning as a result of consuming contaminated carrot juice from Bolthouse Farms
Infants under 6 months of age who lived on the same street at Fort Meade were diagnosed with botulism.
People were diagnosed with botulism after consuming mushrooms contaminated with Clostridium Botulinum
A man was in intensive care for 2 weeks after consuming Nachos to Go
Canned gplant contaminated by Clostrdium Botulinum causes death and hospitalization according to the Infectious Diseases Hospital
Several cases of botulism resulting from mushroom poisoning have been registered
Earth's Best Organic 2 Apple Peach Barleyt Wholesome Breakfast baby food may be contaminated
Marcella's Garden brand olives may be contaminated with Clostridium Botulinum
The CFIA is warning people not to consume clams and cod liver sold by a Canadian food company because they may be contaminated
Two Italian based companies are recalling Cerignola Olives, Nocellara Olives and Castelvertrano Olives because they may be contaminated
Several citizens were hospitalized after consuming poor qulity food
Several perople were hospitalized as a result of consuming canned food products contamintaed with Clostridium Botulinum
After consuming mushrooms collected in the region, a couple of citizens contracted botulism
Alcohol infusion from mushrooms led several people to contract botulism
Several inhabitants of the Rostov region contracted botulism from canned vegetables and dried fish
The Spanish Food Agency reports that a batch of Viuda de Mateo brand preserved artichokes were contaminated
A man hospitalized with  botulism poisoning after possibly consuming Castleberry Chili
Smoked Sardines that were processed uneviscerated may contain Clostridium Botulinum
A child was diagnosed with infanile botulism after consuming tainted baby food
2 victims died of wound botulism related to black tar heroin use
Some children contracted botulism after consuming Castleberry's Austex Hot Dog Chili Sauce Original
Health department workers searched for and confiscated Castleberry Chili products, which contain Clostridium botulinum, from convenience stores and other locations
Future International Inc. is recalling dried "vobla" because it may be contaminated
Castleberry's Hot Dog Chili Sauce and Kroger Hot Dog Chilli Sauce are confirmed to be contaminated with Clostridium Botulinum
Some victims were hospitalized after consuming chili tainted with Clostridium Botulinum
A woman was hospitalized with botulism after consuming Kroger chili
After consumbing Castleberry chili, several people were hospitalized for botulism poisoning
Flora Foods recalled its Cerignola Olives because they may be contaminated
7 Uzlov brand herring from Kransniy Oktyabr Inc. may be contaminated with Clostridium Botulinum
Cibo Specialty Foods recalled their Dal Raccolto brand olives due to pH and water activity levels unfit to control botulism
A married couple contracted botulism after consuming Castleberry's Hot Dog Chili Sauce Original
A couple contracted botulism as aresult of homemade canning in an isolated incident
Royal Seafood Baza Inc. recalled pacakges of Dried Roach because theu may be contaminated with Clostridium Botulinum
New Era Canning Company recalled their green bean products because they may contain Clostridium Botulinum

A 4.5 month old child was found to have botulism after ingesting fermented organic banana/peach puree from a European commercial company. It remains unsettled if the case was due to infantile or foodborne botulism because the puree jar was thrown out after its use.
French Agriculture Ministry investing a batch of duck fois gras [Monfort label] found by the national laboratory and said to be contaminated with Clostridium botulinum
A mother and daughter presented severe cases of botulism after consuming chicken enchiladas that were not properly stored. They remain hospitalized due to complete paralysis.
Heroin users became ill with botulism after using drugs contaminated with Clostridium botulinum spores.
Producer of a canned truffle sauce may be contaminated with Clostridium botulinum
9-month-old Japanese child is diagnosed with infantile botulism. Patient had botulism due to the type E botulinum toxin
The Press service of Tolyatti Municipality reported cases of botulism during the first 3 months of 2008 due to consumption of homemade mushrooms or fish.
Several villagers were admitted to a hospital after consuming Omul fish
A 12-year-old girl was hospitalized with a serious case of botulism after consumed homemade salted omul
In a span of 5 days, many cases of botulism wer reported as a result of the use of homemade low-quality products
Cases of botulism were reported when some people fell sick after consuming dried bream
An outbreak occurred involving homemade products such as mushroom marinades, dried fish and canned vegetables
Homemade mushrooms contaminated with Clostridium botulinum caused several people in the Moscow region to be hospitalized
The presence of Clostridium botulinum related to homemade smoked/dried fish has been confirmed
Investigation on an outbreak of botulism as a result of consuming homemade canned tomatoes
40-day-old infant was found to have botulism and a second case was reported soon after
Three High School students fell ill after eating unknown food contaminated with Clostridium botulinum.
Seymours of Norfolk recalled 7 varieties of infused olive oil products due to a technical fault that may have lead to the growth of Clostridium botulinum.
A 3 day old baby fell ill with the rare strain of infant botulism, type Fm in January 2008. The boy has since recovered and was discharged from the hospital.
Croaker sold at Grand Supercenter, Inc. may be contaminated with Clostridium botulinum
New Era Canning Company expands risk potential to all canned green beans and garbanzo beans distributed over the last five years
Bean salad sold at Kroger Co deli counters may be contaminated with Clostridium botulinum as a result of being shipped from New Era Canning Co.
Croakers from Seoul Shik Poom, Inc. may be contaminated by Clostridium botulinum
Four Bean Salad sold under Kay's Gourmet and Walker's Food Products Co. brand names may be contaminated with Clostridium botulinum
Soup from Schumacher's Inn tested positive for botulism
Bella Cucina's porcini and parmesan pesto was found to have higher than normal pH which could cause the pesto to be contaminated with Clostridium botulinum
Tipu's Tiger Chai was found to have higher than normal pH levels and may be contaminated with Clostridium botulinum

New Era Canning Company announced that a record review indicated the possibility that a small number of cans shipped out containing Mexican style chili beans, green beans, and dark red kidney beans may not have been properly cooked and are at risk for being contaminated with Clostridium botulinum
An olive oil dip sold through Williams-Sonoma retail stores may harbor Clostridium botulinum
A person was found to have botulism [type B] from repeated ingestion of contaminated homemade hot chili pepper in oil
A 4-month old was diagnosed with botulism after suffering from loss of appetite, lethargy and breathing problems
A man and his three grandchildren contracted botulism after eating home-canned green beans.
Heroin users became ill with botulism after using drugs contaminated with Clostridium botulinum spores.

Ungutted, salt-cured alewives (also called gaspereaux fish) may contain Clostridium botulinum. The fish were imported from Canada into the state of Florida to the following distributors: Quirch Foods Inc., Den-Mar Exports LLC, Dolphin Fisheries Inc., Labrador & Son Food Products Inc.

K-Fat Inc., Brooklyn, NY is recalling "Golden Dragon Fish brand Frozen Cooked Mackerel Fish" because the product was found to be uneviscerated prior to processing. Uneviscerated products have the possibility of being contaminated by the botulism bacteria which can devastating for the consumers of the product.
The doctors believe that 4 patients could have been poisoned by marinated mushrooms.
Two people in South Kazakhstan province were hospitalized with a preliminary diagnosis of botulism while 12 more were diagnosed with the same disease in the Almaty region.

Stonewall Kitchen of York, Maine is voluntarily recalling 7 dessert sauces because they have the potential to be contaminated with Clostridium botulinum since it did not meet our pH level and water activity standards.

The vacuum-packaged dried chechon was sampled by a New York State Department of Agriculture and Market Food Inspector during a routine inspection. Subsequent analysis of the product by New York State Food Laboratory personnel confirmed the fish was not properly eviscerated prior to processing which could trigger the growth of botulism in the food.
An adult and two children were sickened by botulism from improperly canned green beans from a home garden.
Plum Organics of Emeryville, California, is recalling some of its apple and carrot portable pouch baby food because of concerns over possible botulism contamination.
4 pateints were admitted to the hospital with signs of botulism. The source of poisoning is suspected to be prepackaged cheese consumes by all 4 patients.
A baby is suspected to have contracted botulism from sucking a dummy dipped in honey. Researchers have found honey to be involved with other cases of Botulism but without confirmation.
The 4 patients from the same family consumed canned egglant during a family reunion.

The suspected food source of infection was a vacuum-packed hot-smoked whitefish of Canadian origin purchased by the family during a visit to Finland and consumed several weeks later in France on the day prior to symptom onset.
The two patients were found to have consumed heroin which is suspected to be the reason for wound botulism.

Haifa Smoked Fish recalled Haifa brand vacuum packaged Whole Schmaltz Herring because the product was found to be uneviscerated. The product was analyzed during a routine inspection and uneviscerated food are prohibited in the New York State area.
Botulism was suspected in 3 people who had consumed soybean products produced by Taoyuan County-based factory.
Tri-Union Seafoods announced a recall of Chicken of the Sea 12 ounce cans of solid white tuna packed in water, citing that a production error caused some issues with proper sealing.

The Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) and Cowichan Valley Meat Market are warning the public not to consume the pepperoni products described below because they may be contaminated with Clostridium botulinum.
5 People were hospitalized showing symptoms of Botulism after consuming semismoked fish at a party.

Foremost Foods, International, Inc. of Pomona, California, is issuing a voluntary recall on certain Tomi brand dried seafood products because they have the potential to be contaminated with Clostridium botulinum, a bacterium which can cause life-threatening illness or death.
